alert.note: Alert for Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 09 at 2:03AM MDT until May 10 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LONG DURATION RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE SANDIA, MANZANO, AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS THROUGH 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS, SEVERAL HOURS OF SINGLE DIGIT HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ALL OTHER AREAS FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MDT TODAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN EASTWARD TO THE EASTERN PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .A dire and critical to extreme fire weather event continues. This long duration of strong, gusty and potentially damaging winds will continue today along with exceptionally low afternoon humidity and poor overnight humidity recoveries. Above normal temperatures will also persist into the middle of the week along with high Haines indices that will yield very unstable conditions leading to rapid and potentially catastrophic fire spread and growth. Winds will decrease tonight, but gusty winds will redevelop over the eastern half of New Mexico Tuesday, leading to another round of critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch for Tuesday is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains through 9PM MDT this evening. The most critical fire weather conditions will be during the morning through early afternoon. Critical conditions are expected to redevelop late Tuesday morning through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest winds of 30 to 40 mph with occasional gusts of 55 to 65 mph on today and Monday. South southwest winds of 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 6 to 10 percent each day with long durations of single digit relative humidities. Poor overnight recoveries can also be expected. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread very rapidly and will be dangerously difficult to control. In addition, long range spotting and extreme fire behavior is possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of these Red Flag Warnings.
